item.title: This solar-powered device harvests water from dry air     - CNET
item.description: A tiny box produces fresh water using only sunlight for power. Could it help solve our global water crisis?

item.title: Hacked NSA tools put Windows users at possible risk     - CNET
item.description: Shadow Brokers hacking group claims it's leaked government malware designed to break into Windows computers.

item.title: Watch the Onion attempt to make Sprint funny (funnier?)     - CNET
item.description: Commentary: Welcome to an ad series in which Sprint attempts to play up its use of the former Verizon pitchman, Paul Marcarelli. And attempt to be funny.

item.title: 'How many RTs' is a viral monster and nuggets are to blame     - CNET
item.description: Social Cues: A viral tweet asking for free Wendy's nuggets is starting a new trend on social media.

item.title: Volvo's first EV will probably be built in China     - Roadshow
item.description: As will the 2018 S90 sedan, after being moved from its current production facility in Sweden.

item.title: Your Galaxy S8 might be getting a coat of armor     - CNET
item.description: An AT&T phone code-named Cruiser is reportedly an upcoming Active variant of Samsung's Galaxy S8.

item.title: The 'Star Wars: The Last Jedi' trailer has arrived     - CNET
item.description: The internet waited patiently for a 2-minute teaser for a film that doesn't even come out for eight months. And, honestly, IT WAS WORTH IT.

item.title: GM investing $14M in, adding 1,100 jobs at Cruise Automation     - Roadshow
item.description: It's also getting a sweet tax break in the process.

item.title: 'It's time to go': Peter Capaldi on leaving 'Doctor Who'     - CNET
item.description: Peter Capaldi, Steven Moffat and the Doctor's new companion Pearl Mackie dish about season 10, Star Trek and a different regeneration.

item.title: Bill Gates thought Windows Solitaire was too hard to win     - CNET
item.description: Wes Cherry was a bored intern at Microsoft when he wrote Windows Solitaire, he tells the Great Big Story video network.

item.title: Here's the first look at Carrie Fisher in 'The Last Jedi'     - CNET
item.description: At Star Wars Celebration Orlando, director Rian Johnson talks about working on the script with Fisher and gives fans a peek at the set.

item.title: Everything we spotted in that 'Star Wars: The Last Jedi' trailer     - CNET
item.description: Let's theorize and hypothesize and spend all day speculating what the heck is going on here. (We have eight months to kill. What's stopping you?)

item.title: Hydraulic press crushes a Furby into your nightmares     - CNET
item.description: The classic electronic Furby toy tangles with a hydraulic press to create a new vision of horror.

item.title: Alphabet's newest smartwatch is not what you'd expect     - CNET
item.description: Nope, you can't buy it. The Study Watch is a new tool for investigative medicine.

item.title: Why would Nintendo get rid of the NES Classic?     - CNET
item.description: The NES Classic going away doesn't make any sense, no matter what theory is applied.

item.title: Facebook knocks down massive spammer network     - CNET
item.description: The social network says it had been "combating" the operation for six months.

item.title: Lucid shows 217 mph electric car at New York Auto Show     - Roadshow
item.description: The Dodge Demon may have dominated the New York Auto Show, but new electric car maker Lucid looks set to give it future competition, announcing that its Alpha Speed Car was tested at 217 mph.

item.title: New Audi R8 LMS GT4 race car is one serious looker     - Roadshow
item.description: Then again, I'm a sucker for a good set of canards.

item.title: 'Last Jedi' trailer sparks Force of funny Twitter reactions     - CNET
item.description: Once fans stopped freaking out, they had some jokes to make, and many involved Jar Jar.

item.title: Apple receives autonomous-car testing permit in California     - Roadshow
item.description: Oh, great -- more fuel for the "Apple Car" fire.

item.title: Nintendo sells almost a million Switch consoles in first month     - CNET
item.description: More than 900,000 Switch units have sold so far in North America, making it Nintendo's fastest-ever selling console.

item.title: See a razor-equipped drone play real-life Fruit Ninja     - CNET
item.description: A drone with a razor blade attached slices up bananas, apples, cucumbers, kiwis and tomatoes at 70 mph in this crazy video.

item.title: Saturn's adorable UFO-shaped moon, Atlas, gets a close-up     - CNET
item.description: Can a moon be cute? If you're a tiny Saturn moon that resembles a flying saucer, the answer is "Yes!"

item.title: Uber may face $1.13M in fines over drunk-driving complaints     - CNET
item.description: California regulators say the ride-hailing firm didn't promptly suspend or investigate Uber drivers suspected of working under the influence.

item.title: Goodbye, NES Classic: Nintendo stopping shipments this month     - CNET
item.description: Forget about your hopes of getting an NES Classic at a regular price this year.
